name: From Code to Release: DevOps for Developers
description: Session information to be announced by 15 August

name: Break
description: Time for networking with attendees, presenters, and Red Gaters

name: Build a Database Deployment Pipeline
description: The pace of business is always getting faster and application development moves right with it. But we still deploy databases the same way we did 10 years ago. This session addresses the changes that we need in organizational structure, processes, and technology, to arrive at a nimble, fast, automatable, and continuous database deployment process. We'll use actual customer case studies to illustrate the common methods and the unique context that lead to a continuous delivery process which is best described as a pipeline. You will learn how to customize common practices and tool sets to build a database deployment pipeline unique to your environment, so you can speed up your own database delivery while still protecting your organization's most valuable asset: its data.

name: Avoiding a DBA's worst days with monitoring
description: When things go wrong with a database, it can be the start of the worst day of a DBA's life. Join Steve Jones as he examines the problems uncovered by The DBA Team and how you can prevent them with proactive monitoring and in-depth knowledge of SQL Server.

name: All day drop-in, hands-on Labs
description: The hands-on labs give you the opportunity to dig into the tools and processes featured in the main sessions. The hands-on labs room will contain all the equipment and guidance you need to explore Red Gate's solutions at your own pace. The product developers will also be on call if you have any questions. You'll be able to follow step-by-step tutorials on setting up source control for a database, automating testing, and find out what it's like to deploy a database at the push of a button.

name: Version control and CI fundamentals for databases
description: Getting your database under version control is ultimately a way of communicating changes and collaborating with team members, maintaining an audit trail and ensuring you always have a version to roll back to. In this session, we'll cover why this gives you and your team a crucial advantage in reducing the risk in your development processes. We'll also discuss another door that your team opens by adopting solid version control: setting up the fundamentals of continuous integration. You will learn what build automation means as a first step towards continuous integration and the value it brings as part of your evolving deployment process.

Avoiding a DBA's worst days with monitoring

name: How to read execution plans
description: It's one thing to know to look for scans instead of seeks, but if you really want to know what's going on in an execution plan, you need to dive deep. This session covers the basics of reading execution plans, and goes way beyond them, to cover as much of the information available in an execution plan as you will ever need. We'll look at how to interpret parameter sniffing and spot when a JOIN operation is not performing the way you want. We'll use the graphical plan and the XML behind it to thoroughly explore execution plans.

name: Automating your database deployments
description: Deploying your database changes to production can be nerve-wracking. We'll discuss methods that take the stress out of the process by ensuring that you practise your deployments before you ever get near production. Automating the deployment and testing processes through your testing and pre-production environments can make the whole experience of production deployments more repeatable, more reliable and more robust. In this session, we'll explore the concept of continuous delivery for databases â€“ what to consider, the challenges, the benefits, the testing, and the crucial approval gates necessary for a reliable production deployment. We'll discuss these and other release strategies as you think about how to evolve your deployment pipeline towards a more automated approach, starting with continuous integration and ending at your production systems.

name: SQL Server tips and tricks
description: This is a presentation for the YouTube generation. Come discover a series of 20 SQL tips on a wide variety of topics, including SQL Server Reporting Services, Integration Services, performance tuning, architecture, indexing, management, and tooling. Each tip is about 3-5 minutes long and each one comes with a demo. If you know a tip already, just wait it out for the next. Ike promises you'll learn something.
